    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      This constructor is recommended to be used over the above.
      AccessManagementService(java.lang.String url, java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password)
      This constructor has issues with performance due to requiring a new connection for every query.

    • Method Detail

      • grantExplicitResourceAccess

        @AuditLog(value="explicit access granted by \'{{mdc:caller}}\' to resource \'{{accessGrant.resourceId}}\' defined as \'{{accessGrant.resourceDefinition.serviceName}}|{{accessGrant.resourceDefinition.resourceType}}|{{accessGrant.resourceDefinition.resourceName}}\' for accessors \'{{accessGrant.accessorIds}}\' with relationship \'{{accessGrant.relationship}}\': {{accessGrant.attributePermissions}}")
public void grantExplicitResourceAccess(@NotNull @Valid
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         @NotNull @Valid ExplicitAccessGrant accessGrant)
        Grants explicit access to resource accordingly to record configuration. Access can be granted to a user or multiple users for a resource.

        Operation is performed in a transaction so that if not all records can be created then whole grant will fail.

        Parameters:
        accessGrant - an object that describes explicit access to resource
        Throws:
        PersistenceException - if any persistence errors were encountered causing transaction rollback

      • revokeResourceAccess

        @AuditLog(value="explicit access revoked by \'{{mdc:caller}}\' to resource \'{{accessMetadata.resourceId}}\' defined as \'{{accessMetadata.resourceDefinition.serviceName}}|{{accessMetadata.resourceDefinition.resourceType}}|{{accessMetadata.resourceDefinition.resourceName}}\' from accessor \'{{accessMetadata.accessorId}}\' with relationship \'{{accessMetadata.relationship}}\': {{accessMetadata.attribute}}")
public void revokeResourceAccess(@NotNull @Valid
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           @NotNull @Valid ExplicitAccessMetadata accessMetadata)
        Removes explicit access to resource accordingly to record configuration.

        IMPORTANT: This is a cascade delete function and so if called on a specific attribute it will remove specified attribute and all children attributes.

        Parameters:
        accessMetadata - an object to remove a specific explicit access record
        Throws:
        PersistenceException - if any persistence errors were encountered

      • filterResource

        public java.util.List<FilteredResourceEnvelope> filterResource(@NotBlank
                                                               @NotBlank java.lang.String userId,
                                                               @NotEmpty
                                                               @NotEmpty java.util.Set<java.lang.String> userRoles,
                                                               @NotNull
                                                               @NotNull java.util.List<Resource> resources)
        Filters a list of JsonNode to remove fields that user has no access to (no READ permission) and returns an envelope response consisting of id, filtered json and permissions for attributes.
        Parameters:
        userId - accessor ID
        userRoles - accessor roles
        resources - envelope Resource and corresponding metadata
        Returns:
        envelope list of FilteredResourceEnvelope with resource ID, filtered JSON and map of permissions if access to resource is configured, otherwise null
        Throws:
        PersistenceException - if any persistence errors were encountered

      • filterResource

        @AuditLog(value="filtered access to resource \'{{resource.id}}\' defined as \'{{resource.definition.serviceName}}|{{resource.definition.resourceType}}|{{resource.definition.resourceName}}\' for accessor \'{{userId}}\' in roles \'{{userRoles}}\': {{result.access.accessType}} access with relationships {{result.relationships}} and permissions {{result.access.permissions}}")
public FilteredResourceEnvelope filterResource(@NotBlank
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     @NotBlank java.lang.String userId,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     @NotEmpty
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     @NotEmpty java.util.Set<java.lang.String> userRoles,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     @NotNull @Valid
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     @NotNull @Valid Resource resource)
        Filters JsonNode to remove fields that user has no access to (no READ permission). In addition to that method also returns map of all permissions that user has to resource.
        Parameters:
        userId - accessor ID
        userRoles - accessor roles
        resource - envelope Resource and corresponding metadata
        Returns:
        envelope FilteredResourceEnvelope with resource ID, filtered JSON and map of permissions if access to resource is configured, otherwise null.
        Throws:
        PersistenceException - if any persistence errors were encountered

      • getRolePermissions

        @AuditLog(value="returned role access to resource defined as \'{{resourceDefinition.serviceName}}|{{resourceDefinition.resourceType}}|{{resourceDefinition.resourceName}}\' for role \'{{roleName}}\': permissions \'{{result.permissions}}\' from access type \'{{result.roleAccessType}}\' and security classifications \'{{result.securityClassifications}}\' due to role security classification \'{{result.roleSecurityClassification}}\'")

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           @NotNull @Valid ResourceDefinition resourceDefinition,

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           @NotBlank java.lang.String roleName)
        Retrieves RolePermissions filtered by role security classification for a specific resource and role.
        Parameters:
        resourceDefinition - ResourceDefinition a unique service name, resource type and resource name
        roleName - user role name
        Returns:
        RolePermissions a combination of permissions and security classifications for a role name
        Throws:
        PersistenceException - if any persistence errors were encountered

      • getResourceDefinitionsWithRootCreatePermission

        Retrieves a set of ResourceDefinition that user roles have root level create permissions for.
